title: Gomoku
rules_text: The goal of the game is to order unbroken row of five signs horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. You play by clicking with mouse on any empty field of the board. Then it is turn of Player 2 (in this case Computer). And then it is your turn again and so on.
about_text: Historical records indicate that the origins of gomoku can be traced back to the mid-1700s during the Edo period. It is said that the 10th generation of Kuwanaya Buemon, a merchant who frequented the Nij≈ç family, was highly skilled in this game, which subsequently spread among the people. The name Gomoku is from the Japanese language, Go means five, moku is a counter word for pieces. In the nineteenth century, the game was introduced to Britain where it was known as Go Bang.
